name: "8 Simple Rules for Buying my Teenage Daughter" Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who babysits Stewie in the beginning of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Meg.

	Lois and Peter decide to go out for a fancy dinner, and they leave meg in charge.  She ends up having a horrible night and she decides she would rather do more fun things with her time.

questions.text: According to Peter, what was a big rip-off?
questions.explanation:
breakfast machine.

	Peter goes on to talk about his breakfast machine, and a flashback is shown.  The contraption goes through a series of events until Peter is shot for no apparent reason.  He says the machine was pointless because it never made his breakfast.

questions.text: On what day did Lois and Peter have their fancy dinner?
questions.explanation:
Saturday.

	Later that night, Peter attempts to buy a few things from Mort's Pharmacy, but he has no money on him.  Mort allows Peter to run a tab, but Peter thinks he's getting everything for free.

questions.text: How much money does Peter owe Mort at the end of the month?
questions.explanation:
$34,000.

	After taking so much from Mort, Peter finally had to pay him back.  Instead of using money, Peter sells Meg to Mort and Neil to pay off the debt.

questions.text: What is the name of Neil's girlfriend in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Cecilia.

	In this episode, Neil actually finds someone who doesn't think he's gross.  In fact, she thinks that his acne is sexy.  Meg begins to feel jealous because someone actually likes him, and she starts to become attracted to him.

questions.text: Eventually, Stewie gets a new babysitter named Lidanne.  What game do they play together?
questions.explanation:
Jenga.

	Stewie ends up having a lot of fun with Lidanne, and he starts to get a crush on her.  Eventually, he becomes so deeply involved that he's willing to go to extreme measures to be with her.

questions.text: What is the name of Lidanne's boyfriend?
questions.explanation:
Jeremy.

	When Lidanne invites Jeremy over to see Stewie, he seems like a pretty nice guy, but Stewie still decides to take him out of the picture.  Stewie decides to ambush Jeremy at his house.

questions.text: Who does Meg pretend to date in front of Neil?
questions.explanation:
Jake.

	Jake is Tom Tucker's son.  When Meg brings Jake to the pharmacy, she tells Neil that she loves him and they decide to be together.  The situation takes a turn for the worse and Meg is forced to work off Peter's debts by performing difficult tasks.

questions.text: Where does Stewie hide his babysitter's boyfriend's body?
questions.correct: In the trunk of a car
questions.explanation:
In the trunk of a car.

	In the end of the episode, Stewie finally remembers that he forgot to take Jeremy out of the trunk.  By this time, two weeks have passed since the incident occurred.

questions.text: What character from "X-Men" does Lois dress up as in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Mystique.

	Lois does this to help Meg in the end.  Peter somehow thinks of an idea that will make Meg's contract ruined, and Neil easily falls into the trap.  In the end, Meg is jealous when Neil goes back to Cecilia, Lois feels wrong about the situation, and Peter remains his regular self.
